children.content: Chronic (see Transient Ischemic Attack and Stroke)
Evaluate risk factors for secondary prevention: Hypertension, Diabetes, Cholesterol, Smoking, Obesity, Cardiovascular
See ACCP 2004 guidelines for assistance with choice of antiplatelet agents (aspirin plus dipyridamole or clopidogrel)
Etiology related to atrial fibrillation or other cardiogenic source (except endocarditis)
Evaluate and manage carotid or other extracranial or intracranial vascular etiology
If >70% stenosis, consider surgical or endovascular treatment
